means: 建立( establish的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: The old-timers and established families clutched the reins of power.
sentence.Network_cn: 久居此地的居民和根基稳固的家族牢牢掌控着权力。

sentence.Network_en: Medical tests established that she was not their own child.
sentence.Network_cn: 医学化验证实她不是他们的亲骨肉。

sentence.Network_en: Einstein had the chutzpah to discard common sense and long-established theory.
sentence.Network_cn: 爱因斯坦敢于抛弃常识和长期公认的理论。

已建立的连接（established），也包括监听连接请求（listening）的那些连接。

jx.jx_en_mean: the Church of England or of Scotland
jx.jx_cn_mean: 英国国教会，圣公会；苏格兰长老会

encyclopedia.content: 含义 TCP:连接成功。 服务端端口状态解释 服务端,端口的状态变化 先在本机（IP地址为：192.168.1.10）配置FTP服务，然后在其它计算机（IP地址为：192.168.1.1）访问FTP服务，从TCPView看看端口的状态变化。 下面黑体字显示的是从TCPView中截取的部分。 1、LISTENING状态 FTP服务启动后首先处于侦听（LISTENING）状态。 State显示是LISTENING时表示处于侦听状态，就是说该端口是开放的，等待连接，但还没有被连接。就像你房子的门

entry.tran: 已被认可的;已被接受的
entry.def: If you use established to describe something such as an organization, you mean that it is officially recognized or generally approved of because it has existed for a long time.

example.ex: Their religious adherence is not to the established church.
...qualified lawyers with established and prestigious business addresses.
example.tran: 在一些颇有声望的老牌事务所工作的资深律师们

means.word_mean: 1. brought about or set up or accepted; especially long established;

sentences.sentence: "a team established as a member of a major league"
"enjoyed his prestige as an established writer"
"holds a firm position as the country's leading poet"
"that smoking causes health problems is an accomplished fact"

means.word_mean: 4. shown to be valid beyond a reasonable doubt;
6. introduced from another region and persisting without cultivation

auth_sentence.content: This can only be established through a soil test.
auth_sentence.res_content: This can only be established through a soil test.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This can only be established through a soil test.

auth_sentence.content: It's on an established range, Lapan said.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's on an established range, Lapan said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's on an established range, Lapan said.

auth_sentence.content: They established the fashion for Christmas cards and present-giving.
auth_sentence.res_content: They established the fashion for Christmas cards and present-giving.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They established the fashion for Christmas cards and present-giving.

Sentence.sentence: Suburban high schools were established in the hope of increasing economic efficiency.
Steven Kayne, who has just taken over and established bicycle shop.
He established a new style of leadership.
The government also established a stockpile (贮存) of oil as a short-term buffer (缓冲) against future shortages.

Instead of protecting speech and encouraging diversity and innovative thinking, the tenure system often stifles(压制)them: younger professors must win the approval of established colleagues for tenure, encouraging like-mindedness and sometimes inhibiting the free flow of ideas.
Its meaning was clarified when it was established in Australia.

means.word_mean: 已建立的；已设立的；已制定的

sentences.en: Established practices are difficult to modify.
sentences.cn: 既定的惯例是很难更改的。

sentences.en: He was appointed to the newly established Department of the Environment.
sentences.cn: 他获任命到新成立的环保部工作。

sentences.en: He was seen as a threat to the established order.
sentences.cn: 他被看作是对已有秩序的威胁。

sentences.en: Degree courses have traditionally focused on the established great writers of the past.
sentences.cn: 学位课程的内容一直以来都集中于过去的知名作家。
